57bQGVErR-5NHz9MoiW7hw.text: What a great find just down the road from our AirBnB    This cute little cafe serves wonderful coffee and delicious food. We ordered the Red Kite Breakfast with an extra egg and the tomato left fresh. I don't usually eat bread but the sourdough looked and smelled so appetising that I couldn't resist.   I would definitely recommend Red Kite to anyone looking for satisfying breakfast before hitting the sites.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Kite Café - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Rnf94gsTcNg4Wpztf6XiTw.text: Delicious breakfast in a cute cafe. The hot chocolate wasn't too sweet and I will be returning for more during my stay here in Edinburgh. The staff was friendly and the atmosphere was relaxing. It would make a great place to study or read a book.

g-BaFueUa6cAbFzX_SLyvg.text: A wonderful breakfast place in Edinburgh  (pronounced Edinberah) I had The Red Kite breakfast and exchanged the baked beans for Veggie Haggis .  OMG... i need that recipe. Community tables available, warm friendly staff.  A favorite place for locals and the lucky tourists who stumble in after a long night in Edinburgh.  Krista had the Avacado Toast, spinach salad... she loved it. Tables were clean so was the floors...And So Was the Toilet! I rarely give 5 stars... but this place is wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Kite Café - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tea!!!
Photo of Red Kite Café - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Red Kite Café - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

LwU43jH-Q00AGcOWf2EgEA.text: Red Kite has excellent teas and coffees and the scones are honestly to die for. The desert options are also rather exquisite. For me it really shines during the weekdays, when you can order a small soup + quiche.

JJkYP9dh7vW7sQuFBnNgtw.text: My husband and I found this gem because it was a 30 second walk from our Airbnb. The cappuccino was perfectly done, the almond croissant was delicious and fluffy, and the breakfast sandwiches on their homemade brioche buns....omg best little breakfast we had while in Edinburgh. Each time we were in there, it was mainly all locals- that's how you know it's good!!

photos.caption: Photo of Red Kite Café - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Red Kite Café - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Red Kite Café - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

RV9rIn297GIA7_VEPGuNtw.text: Cozy little place with very homy decorations. The atmosphere feels very relaxed as if staying at home in a rainy day. Staff was great and very friendly.  I had the big breakfast sampler and it was amazing. The eggs were a perfect sunny side up. The sausage and bacon complimented each other in taste. The ciabatta bread was crunchy and went well with all the meats. Top it off with a latte and it feels like mom cooked you a home cooked meal back at home feel to it. I would definitely come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Kite Café - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Red Kite Café - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Red Kite Café - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

JtbM0PTDsSRyQQ7wuowUSA.text: It's our first time in Edinburgh and this is the only restaurant that we came back to!! The staff is so friendly and helpful. The food is creative and different each time. It was all delicious and fresh! We will definitely come back the next time we visit!

NnozrF0q5F0Ts8AWN26wRw.text: Came into this cafe for a quick lunch while I had clothes in the local laundry. I had the ham and cheddar sandwich and a split bean soup. It was so good. After our lunch I ordered a white pomegranate tea and a blondie. Both were so delicious, I had to take a blondie to go.   I had a very pleasant experience and food was great as well. If I ever return to Edinburgh I will definitely return to the Red Kite cafe.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Kite Café - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cappuccino
Photo of Red Kite Café - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. White pomegranate tea and a blondie
Photo of Red Kite Café - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. I had the Ham and cheddar sandwich with a split bean soup, he had the salmon sandwich with soup... can&#39;t remember the name right now.

BXtYXyfAWpdP6BvT0YjCUQ.text: Great find. Proper house made foods. We had a lovely breakfast there on a cool Monday morning in July. The Harrisa and eggs with herbs on house baked toast hit the spot. My brother in law's egg on a bun with bacon and sausage looked scrumptious. The cappuccino was executed perfectly. We will be returning!

kf-DW_Jx7YJA6hLF21FoBQ.text: Red kite cafe is the new addition to gentrifying Abbeyhill, and is a lovely place for coffee or brunch.  The interior looks lovely, lots of wood, plants and flowers and cute details. Something I always love to see is that they support local artists by putting their art on their walls with a pricetag. There is lots of open space, so parents don't need to worry about prams being blocked. You can sit in the windowsill, at a normal table or on a lovely sofa.  Another way you can see the social conscience of Red kite is by looking at their menu. Free range eggs and sausages and good local produce.  The brunch menu looked particularly appetising, with classic breakfast options as well as pumpkin & sage fritters and shaksuka (always wanted to try this)! A breakfast item will set you back around 7. I opted for a soy flat white and it was pretty good, no complaints! Next time I'll be back for some grub!

photos.caption: Photo of Red Kite Café - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tasty treats
Photo of Red Kite Café - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

ZPh2AIkX64KTeHKy61ni7A.text: Love this place. I've been 6-7 times in my first 3 weeks in Edinburgh for breakfast and a place to get work done. The menu is small but changes every few days, and everything is good including the vegetarian options. Their lattes are perfect and the staff is very friendly.

eQmZqn4s-Ug6J1qY-e0s0A.text: Handsome interior, friendly staff, and delicious food. I had the cauliflower tomato curry with turmeric bread, it was so fresh and light. Love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Kite Café - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cauliflower tomato curry with turmeric bread. Amazing!

3FfSYXRi3U17-b6s6NFQEg.text: So pleased. What a beautiful chilled cafe.   Great coffee &lovely almond croissant. Was heated up for me. Little finesses like this are grand.   Fabby art work on the walls. Like a gallery.   I look forward to go again.

bzk9766ZrR3crhjMD3G10A.text: The food and space are very good. I am giving them a mediocre review because of this one rude staff member who work in the afternoons. Came here a couple times to work but she really ruined the vibe for me

2AJEcLsDf7oyR-owenoB8w.text: This cafe is an astounding place for breakfast and lunch. They have something different every day it seems and all dishes I have tried were impeccably thought out and presented. The prices are reasonable, the atmosphere cozy and the cakes are beyond compare. I highly recommend eating here if you are in the area, or even going out of your way to get there.

gyvjwx3FRndhleXAvX-6ww.text: Really nice cafe and honestly the best quiche I've ever had. I highly recommend the quiche!  Great to see original Peter Carrington on the walls. Perfect for a snack and cup of tea.
